info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 1:52PM EDT until May 16 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Hamilton County in eastern New York... Northwestern Fulton County in eastern New York... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 152 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Caroga Lake, or 12 miles northwest of Gloversville, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wells, Caroga Lake, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Sacandaga Campground, Arietta, Wheelerville, Canada Lake, Rudeston, Blackbridge, Averys Place, Bliss Corner, Stewart Landing, Whitehouse, Shaker Place, Peters Corners, Piseco, Higgins Bay, Upper Benson, Gilmantown and Newkirk. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
